p: The acute administration induced an anxiolytic-like effect in the light/dark transition tests (increased time spent in the light side, and in the number of transitions) and in marble burying (decreased number of marbles buried) without any motor impairment, while repeated administration showed effects in the marble-burying test only. Repeated diazepam administrations did not increase light/dark transitions. Thus, the results suggest an anxiolytic-like effect following acute and repeated Citrus aurantium EO administration [ 49].
